trigger.expression: {$ZFS_ARC_MAX_MIN}>0 and (last(/Template OSSO Disk ZFS/zfs.arc.max.syspromille)<{$ZFS_ARC_MAX_MIN} or last(/Template OSSO Disk ZFS/zfs.arc.max.syspromille)>850)
trigger.name: ZFS arc max {ITEM.VALUE} not between $1 %o and 850 %o on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: Herman says (2017-05-03): "sp servers hebben vaak tot 80% ofzo aan ARC. pve nodes hebben van de 128GB, 4GB tot 32GB aan ARC", i.e. 3%..85%.

item.name: ZFS pool changed
item.description: This event is triggered by the zpool check when the zpool has changed. You need to manually close the associated trigger after confirming that All Is Good (tm).

trigger.name: ZFS pool layout diff on {HOST.NAME} (check zpool and /var/lib/zabbix/scripts/zfs.status.saved please)
trigger.description:
You must manually close this when you've confirmed that the zpool is awesome. Manual closing is done by removing /var/lib/zabbix/scripts/zfs.status.saved on the host.
(We wanted to use zabbix_sender, but that causes timeout/unreliability issues when the Server config also contains unresponsive IPs.)

trigger.expression: (last(/Template OSSO Disk ZFS/zfs.pool.json,#1)<>last(/Template OSSO Disk ZFS/zfs.pool.json,#2))=1
trigger.name: ZFS pool layout updated on {HOST.NAME} (disks out/in? please check even if OK'd)

trigger.expression: (last(/Template OSSO Disk ZFS/zfs.version,#1)<>last(/Template OSSO Disk ZFS/zfs.version,#2))>0
trigger.name: ZFS version is now {ITEM.VALUE} on {HOST.NAME}

discovery_rule.name: ZFS dataset discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discover ZFS datasets. Dataset names must contain a "/" else it's a zpool root. And we skip 64-byte docker filesets. See the "@ZFS dataset discovery" regex.

item_prototype.name: Zpool {#POOLNAME} available
item_prototype.description: Yes, the zpool name is also the first dataset, so we can get info from zfs.dataset.info.

item_prototype.name: Zpool {#POOLNAME} used
item_prototype.description: Yes, the zpool name is also the first dataset, so we can get info from zfs.dataset.info.

item_prototype.name: Zpool {#POOLNAME} 4K-rbytes
item_prototype.description: As 4K-pages instead of bytes so you can compare it with rops/wops in a single graph.

item_prototype.name: Zpool {#POOLNAME} 4K-wbytes
item_prototype.description: As 4K-pages instead of bytes so you can compare it with rops/wops in a single graph.

trigger_prototype.expression: (last(/Template OSSO Disk ZFS/zfs.dataset.info[{#POOLNAME},available])*100/(last(/Template OSSO Disk ZFS/zfs.dataset.info[{#POOLNAME},available])+last(/Template OSSO Disk ZFS/zfs.dataset.info[{#POOLNAME},used])))<{$ZFS_SPACE_BELOW_DISASTER}
trigger_prototype.name: Zpool {#POOLNAME} on {HOST.NAME} has less than {$ZFS_SPACE_BELOW_DISASTER}% space

trigger_prototype.expression: (last(/Template OSSO Disk ZFS/zfs.dataset.info[{#POOLNAME},available])*100/(last(/Template OSSO Disk ZFS/zfs.dataset.info[{#POOLNAME},available])+last(/Template OSSO Disk ZFS/zfs.dataset.info[{#POOLNAME},used])))<{$ZFS_SPACE_BELOW_HIGH}
trigger_prototype.name: Zpool {#POOLNAME} on {HOST.NAME} has less than {$ZFS_SPACE_BELOW_HIGH}% space

macro.description: Minimum promille arc-max, or 0 to disable checks
Disaster alert when disk free% reaches below
High alert when disk free% reaches below

trigger.expression: {$ZFS_ARC_MAX_MIN}>0 and last(/Template OSSO Disk ZFS/zfs.arc.max.file)<>last(/Template OSSO Disk ZFS/zfs.arc.max.sys)
trigger.name: ZFS arc max config is not applied on {HOST.NAME} (conf={ITEM.LASTVALUE1}, sys={ITEM.LASTVALUE2})
trigger.description: If the zfs_arc_max is not configured, it's 0 both in the config and the system. But that problem is picked up by the other trigger that wants the max between 3% and 85%.
